intro: Lychnis lusitanica, commonly known as the Portuguese catchfly, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a low-growing herbaceous perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant features hairy stems and basal leaves that are often reddish in color. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense inflorescences, and typically range in color from pink to red. Lychnis lusitanica thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas and along streambanks.
